channel.title: Youtube
channel.description:
Hey guys/girls how do I make my pc let me view videos on mopar?
youtube videos on mopar I cannot see them

item.title: Youtube
item.dc:creator: @vortex vortex
item.description:
@vortex wrote:

tell moparisthebest into changing the code to always use SSL youtube instead

Read full topic

item.title: Youtube
item.dc:creator: @RUNE-PK RUNE-PK
item.description:
@RUNE-PK wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:542801”][quote author=lare69 link=topic=661677.msg4423019#msg4423019 date=1399350773]

Hey guys/girls how do I make my pc let me view videos on mopar?

youtube videos on mopar I cannot see them

It’s because the youtube script is “unsafe” in https. On chrome, there’s a silver shield that shows when you’re on a page with a youtube video, you should be able to click or right click it and run the script. It is safe.

is there any way to automate it? kinda annoying having to do that every time
[/quote]
Yep!
Just figured this out
So create a shortcut on your desktop.
Right click it. Hit properties.
In the “target” path add a space then put:
–allow-running-insecure-content
It should now look like:
C:\Users\YourName\AppData\Local\Google\Chrome\Application\chrome.exe --allow-running-insecure-content
You can then pin this to start or etc, and it will allow ANY insecure content. Just a warning.
Including youtube videos on here.[/quote]

Thanks Sk8r…

Read full topic

item.title: Youtube
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“lare69, post:3, topic:542801”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=661677.msg4422608#msg4422608 date=1399181194]

Hey guys/girls how do I make my pc let me view videos on mopar?

youtube videos on mopar I cannot see them

It’s because the youtube script is “unsafe” in https. On chrome, there’s a silver shield that shows when you’re on a page with a youtube video, you should be able to click or right click it and run the script. It is safe.
[/quote]
is there any way to automate it? kinda annoying having to do that every time[/quote]
Yep!
Just figured this out
So create a shortcut on your desktop.
Right click it. Hit properties.
In the “target” path add a space then put:
–allow-running-insecure-content
It should now look like:
C:\Users\YourName\AppData\Local\Google\Chrome\Application\chrome.exe --allow-running-insecure-content
You can then pin this to start or etc, and it will allow ANY insecure content. Just a warning.
Including youtube videos on here.

Read full topic
